intro: Mesembryanthemum trichosanthum, commonly known as the yellow nightshade or desert star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers that open in the evening. The plant features fleshy, often hairy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals that attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
